snippet: A former Los Angeles County sheriff’s deputy was sentenced to eight years in federal prison for supervising the back-room beating of a jail visitor who fellow guards testified was handcuffed on the ground and covered in blood.
abstract: Eric Gonzalez, former Los Angeles County sheriff’s deputy, is sentenced to eight years in prison following June conviction on charges of civil rights violations and falsification of records; Gonzalez was involved in 2011 beating of Gabriel Carrillo, who was visiting his incarcerated brother at Men’s Central Jail.
lead_paragraph: A former Los Angeles County sheriff’s deputy was sentenced to eight years in federal prison for supervising the back-room beating of a jail visitor who fellow guards testified was handcuffed on the ground and covered in blood.

headline.main: California: Ex-Deputy Gets 8 Years in Jail Beating
headline.print_headline: California: Ex-Deputy Gets 8 Years In Jail Beating

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: Gonzalez, Eric (Los Angeles, Calif, Police Officer)
